Optimize images with reSmush.it API

Source: R/optimize_imgs.R
optimize_imgs.Rd

Optimize images using the reSmush.it API https://resmush.it/. reSmush.it is a FREE API that provides image optimization. reSmush.it limits its use to PNG, JPG, GIF, BMP and TIF pictures up to 5MB.

Usage

optimize_imgs(path, outfile = path, qlty = 92)

optimize_imgs_all(
  dir = c("man/figures", "vignettes"),
  ext = "png$|jpg$",
  qlty = 92
)

Source

https://resmush.it/features

Arguments

path

Path to the files to optimize.

outfile

Output file. By default is path, i.e. overwrites the file provided.

qlty

Integer between 0 and 100. Optimization level (JPG compression only).

dir

Directory or list of directories to optimize.

ext

Regex indicating the extension of the image files to be optimized.

Value

Writes optimized image files on disk.

Examples

# \donttest{

# A jpg file
myjpg <- system.file("img/example.jpg", package = "pkgdev")
destjpg <- tempfile(fileext = ".jpg")

# Regular use
optimize_imgs(myjpg, destjpg)
#> ✔ Optimizing /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/pkgdev/img/example.jpg:
#> ℹ Ratio: 16%
#> ℹ Current size: 76.1 Kb (was 90.6 Kb)
#> ℹ Output: /tmp/RtmpmfZWHi/file18cb7cbcce6.jpg

# Use qlty
optimize_imgs(myjpg, destjpg, qlty = 20)
#> ✔ Optimizing /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/pkgdev/img/example.jpg:
#> ℹ Ratio: 81%
#> ℹ Current size: 17 Kb (was 90.6 Kb)
#> ℹ Output: /tmp/RtmpmfZWHi/file18cb7cbcce6.jpg

# With png
mypng <- system.file("img/example.png", package = "pkgdev")
destpng <- tempfile(fileext = ".png")
optimize_imgs(mypng, destpng)
#> ✔ Optimizing /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/pkgdev/img/example.png:
#> ℹ Ratio: 73%
#> ℹ Current size: 39.4 Kb (was 148.5 Kb)
#> ℹ Output: /tmp/RtmpmfZWHi/file18cb48cad87a.png
# }
